alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 6:38AM EDT until July 11 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Connecticut River...including Holyoke, Middle Haddam, Hartford, Thompsonville, Montague, Holyoke Dam, Northampton... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Deerfield River...including West Deerfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Deerfield River at West Deerfield. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, The Deerfield River oversrpeads some of the lowest lying farmland in the Deerfield area. Floodwaters inundate a portion of Pogues Hole Road. Also lowest lying recreational fields and parking lots nearby the river start to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:16 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 9.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 08/19/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM EDT.
